To investigate the importance of <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to endogenous <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression in response to LPS , we utilized <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - null ( <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - ) and wild-type MEFs ( <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + ) , since RAW264.7 cells constitutively express endogenous <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Wild-type MEFs express low levels of endogenous <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the absence of <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> attenuated endogenous <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression .

LPS stimulated an increase in <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression in wild-type MEFs ( Fig . 6A ) , whereas LPS - stimulated <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression was significantly dampened in <extra_id_0> Cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - MEFs as compared to wild-type .

We next tested if similar effects could be seen in thioglycollate - elicited inflammatory macrophages in which <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression was knocked down using species - specific lentiviral shRNAs ( Fig . 6B , left ) .

As was observed in MEFs , both constitutive and LPS - induced <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression was significantly decreased in <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient inflammatory macrophages ( Fig . 6B , right ) .

These data show that <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is critical for mediating constitutive and LPS - inducible transcription of endogenous <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .
